alert.note: Alert for Black Hills and Southwest Interior Lowlands; Central Coastal Lowlands; North Coastal Lowlands (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued August 14 at 3:26AM PDT until August 14 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 11 PM PDT THIS EVENING FOR HOT, DRY AND UNSTABLE CONDITIONS FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 650, 651, AND 655... The National Weather Service in Seattle has issued a Red Flag Warning for dry and unstable conditions, which is in effect from 11 AM this morning to 11 PM PDT this evening. * AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zone 650 North Coastal Lowlands, Fire Weather Zone 651 Central Coastal Lowlands and Fire Weather Zone 655 Black Hills and Southwest Interior Lowlands. * WINDS...North 5 to 10 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 26 percent. * TEMPERATURES...In the mid to upper 90s. * HAINES...Mid-level Haines 6 or high potential for large plume dominated fire growth. * IMPACTS...A dry and unstable air mass with warm temperatures can contribute to active fire behavior. In western Washington, significant growth on existing fires takes place under such conditions. If a fire were to begin, air quality may diminish in the surrounding area.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either imminent or occurring now. Any fires that develop will likely spread quickly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.

area.areaDesc: Black Hills and Southwest Interior Lowlands; Central Coastal Lowlands; North Coastal Lowlands
